intro: Schottarum sarikeense, commonly known as the Sarikeense Schottia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
